title: What's News: Business & Finance
text:
Rivian Automotive is seeking a valuation in a range just above $60 billion in its initial public offering next week, one of the biggest deals yet in a blockbuster year for new issues.

Chinese developer Yango asked international investors to swap $747 million of dollar debt for new bonds as part of its efforts to avoid default.

The Dow, S&P 500 and Nasdaq closed at records, gaining 0.3%, 0.2% and 0.6%, respectively. The blue-chip index briefly rose above 36000 for the first time.

American Airlines canceled hundreds of additional flights, extending troubles that began during the weekend as it struggles to meet growing travel demand.

The Biden administration took the first significant step to impose banklike oversight on the cryptocurrency companies involved in the issuance of stablecoins.

Apple plans next year to roll out a product feature for iPhones and Apple Watches that would detect automobile accidents.

What's News: Business & Finance
